info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 4 at 9:03PM CDT until July 5 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Furnas.
* WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly some rural county roads and along small creeks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall due to thunderstorms earlier this evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Fortunately, the heaviest rainfall rates have diminished, allowing for this water to soak in or flow downstream through area creeks. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Muddy Creek, Elk Creek, Deer Creek, Beaver Creek and Timmons Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Arapahoe and Holbrook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT
